alert.note: Alert for Madison (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued November 28 at 2:57AM EST until November 29 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Madison county. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 7 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest snow totals are expected over the western portion of the county, near Cazenovia and Chittenango. The highest snowfall rates, over 1 inch per hour are expected this afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
